name: giantants
text: Beef is wanting to be Ray Manzarek, I think is part of the joke.

name: joeyramoney
text: i don't think it is.

name: spectre
text: Beef is doing Devo.

name: giantants
text: He looks Devo but I feel like he is operating in reference to the pretentions of the Doors.

name: sweetlips
text: A comment left by sweetlips was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, twistedechoes, Ariamaki, Majuju, andrewthepig)

name: zaer
text: Jim morrison may have been a douchebag,but he's an awesome douchebag nonetheless.

name: gazdatronik
text: Yeah, the Doors lived and died by Manzarek's left hand.

name: mangaknightz
text: teodor is made out of pure rock

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt2, HSE, nutmeg)

name: hellofyellin
text: He is working those good guitar notes right into the floor with that left foot, he is so into what is going on.

name: ellwooda
text: Lyle is so totally Cliff Burton.  Don't even ever begin to try and deny it.

name: cdl146
text:
Misfits shirt and all.
[IMGS OFF]

name: relaxing
text:
Lyle's handlebar moustache always made me think of Lemmy from Motorhead (and HAWKWIND.)
[IMGS OFF]

name: satellitetv
text: Lemmy even has a Rick

name: belgand
text: Hmmm... it looked more like a slightly off Stingray to me. Considering it has the 3 1 tuning pegs and the layout of the knobs. The main problems are that it doesn't quite have the distinctive egg shaped pickguard of a Stingray and the horns are even instead of uneven.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Lyle is playing approximately a Sting Ray.  It even has only one pick up.

name: nutmeg
text:
always thought it was inspired by the guy from Husker Du.
[IMGS OFF]

name: nutmeg
text:
ahhhhh balls.
[IMGS OFF]

name: relaxing
text: GREAT call!

name: thequietyou
text:
Greg Norton.

I'm a huge dork for Husker Du.

name: rowboat
text: Lyle isn't dead. Don't even ever begin to try and deny it.

name: catachresis
text: Aww damn Philippe just going crazy hitting those drums with his Batman shirt and Beef being supportive gets me every time

name: agika
text: You just know the audience members are clapping their asses off for Phillipe's drum solo.

name: bixschmix
text:
HUUUUUGS!*clap clap* HUUUUUUUGS! *clap clap*

All supportive of Phillipe.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: "Maybe play it again a little later alright" slays me.

name: tellumo
text: That and how he highlights that it was the third guitar note he played that was just perfect. Of course, I'm sure the others were good too, but that rose above even them. Kinda like this strip.

name: gigs
text:
I just wanna know what note the third note is, if it's worth pointing out.

Five bucks says it's a G.

name: jonmw
text:
I reckon it's a B.
B stands for Bitchin. However, it's always the B string that will be a bitch about staying in tune.

name: glorify
text: Chubby for the Demetri Martin reference.

name: ssddr
text: Thick bass steaks.

name: joeyramoney
text: that sounds filthy.

name: stuart
text: "Stuffing your ears with thick bass steaks" sounds like it should be in a Beck song

name: gigs
text:
Doing drive-bys with cheesecake shotguns
Stuffing your ears with thick bass steaks
No one ever said you'd never find your rhythm
And if anyone did, they ain't nothing but fakes

oh look out beck here comes another non-sensical singer-songwriter-producer all up in your grill

name: hbaranov
text: E-Pro is the pinnacle.

name: gournal
text: "Talking trash to the garbage around you."

name: stuart
text: This is really pretty fantastic, if more coherent than your average Beck couplet

name: slalvation
text: I always pronounce "bass" in my head like the fish, which has never been more amusing than it is now.

name: chaesar
text:
Top five, maybe even top 3 of all time. The alt text really clinches it.

"Runner-up: ...and you will not see a picture of your father turn into an eraser and erase your ceiling fan"

Stay with me people.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that last line is the Five Factor for me.

name: snatch22
text: I just love Ray/Beef's obsession with notes.  See: May 10th, 2004.  I also enjoy how Beef makes sure to support Philippe's emomtional state right before he talks about acid.

name: morganization
text: little philippe needs emotional support at his age

name: centipede_damascus
text: When Roast Beef is determined about something, he is a poet of the modern age, a Picasso that paints using the English language.

name: abe
text: Here are your number 2 pencils.

name: epicurus
text: I think about this strip all the time.

name: elohssa
text: A comment left by elohssa was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, Semiquaver, thedudeabides85, nutmeg)

name: darkwaffle
text: I laughed at every panel in this strip. So hard.

name: zeroasalimit
text: A comment left by zeroasalimit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rowboat, Zem, STUART, Darthemed)

name: captain_arlo
text: For the longest time I thought FTW stood for "fuck the what."  It perplexed me as to why people would say that.  I guess they could have been angry existentialists. "Fuck the what!  Long live why!"

name: dreamerman91
text: roast beef's deadpan never ceases to amaze me

name: thisdoggisproice
text: I think it's so important to note how happy pretty much anyone would be if they were at a show where a dude just played the riff from "Day Tripper" about 30 times, then just left and you were instantly assaulted by solo after solo.  That would be infinitely excellent.

name: cousinted
text: Philippe plays the drums the Keith moon way

name: mr_lostman28
text: all drunk out of his mind and stuffing the bass drum with explosives?

name: blotto
text: All driving cars into pools?

name: tekende
text: With a delighted expression that seems fairly fixed?

name: mattylite
text: Puking on his kit, vomit all flying up off the snare drum like the retching version of the blue man group?

name: landowmpg
text: Although, Philippe doesn't actually have a snare drum.  Or a hi-hat for that matter.  But the little fella tries so dang hard.

name: scriblerus
text: People have been introducing the members of the band for decades.  It took Beef to get it right.

name: epicurus
text: Philippe's expression is spot-on.

name: drycup
text: My roommate first year of college told me his story of how he overdosed on acid over the Summer and had to escape from the shower which was trying to suffocate him.  I think of him every time I read this.

name: bixschmix
text: My roommate took acid and turned into a starfish, and then turned into a tuba. We found him in a laundry hamper.

name: cailetshadow
text:
Why would a tuba be in a hamper?

Did you ask him that?

name: deusoma
text: Perhaps he thought it was his carrying case. I think the underwear would have been a dead giveaway, but then I'm not a tuba and I've never tried acid.

name: dtuba
text: I am a tuba

name: johnnybaverage
text: Goo goo g'joob.

name: shemmjacc
text: ahahaha

name: zem
text: pretty much

name: nonamejoe
text: Am I the only one who thinks of Revenge of the Nerds?

name: tbtabby
text: Not at all!

name: mattylite
text: My opinion here doesn't count, because I am always already thinking of Revenge of the Nerds.

name: steerpike66
text: 'He stuffs your ears with his thick bass steaks ' is sort of delicious, sexual and repulsive all at once.

name: hypoluxa
text: "Thick bass steaks"   "Hit all those drums, Phillipe. Just Have a great old time." = instant classic

name: sirptom
text:
This was the first Achewood strip I ever read.

I was so confused.

name: cormanosanchez
text: I actually feel that T is playing pretty decently, but has had no real experience playing in a band so it is negated. Lyle couldn't be that bad either. Thick bass steaks.

name: farqussus
text: If only someone had been supportive when Beef was five.

name: dont_think
text:
listen

he is hitting some excellent guitar notes right now

name: tekende
text:
You have proven you can process, remember, and re-type information.

Congratulations, don't_think, you are the
secretary of the month

name: drskradley
text:
Hey don't dog on it that's the first echelon of Bloom's Taxonomy of Educational Objectives.

Now if he can only employ Creative Synthesis to prove his learning.

name: stuart
text: Listen to the man: he is a "dr"

name: drskradley
text: I had also just finished my Diploma of Education at the time.  Oh man don't get me fucking started.

name: dont_think
text:
listen

he is hitting some excellent guitar notes right now

name: cormanosanchez
text: Also, I dig T's Elvis Costello/Strummer pigeontoed pose.

name: zeal
text: Beef is dressed so New Wave right now that it hurts.

name: vermy
text: So being on acid is a bit like Nightmare on Elm Street?

name: lexsenthur
text: Never has a five year old had such support from such a crowd.

name: semiquaver
text: Outside of the 2000 Republican National Convention, that is.

name: aelindil
text: HEE!

name: swatson
text: Philippe is standing on it! He is standing on the drums! :D

name: hellofyellin
text: Still in his jammies!

name: grombly
text: This has to be the second most punchlines per strip next  to "sort of stoned"

name: spectre
text: Beef is hella channeling his Inner Devo.

name: unityrolf
text: When you wear an outfit like that punctuation is not necessary.

name: catgrl131
text: Oh man, Teodor's legs look hella tiny without his pantaloons. By the way, why pantaloons?

name: cheesesandwich
text: because.... pantaloons!

name: 21echoes
text: this may be one of the top 10 achewood strips ever.

name: ryaldin
text: Beef is so suprisingly in his element here.  He's got confidence just oozing out from that thin black tie.

name: bumpishound
text:
"thick bass steaks"

as a bassist, this strip is the creation myth of all my happiness.

this strip makes me delerious with joy.

name: peterselj
text: Philippe is wearing a Batman shirt.

name: milo
text: Lyle is a combination of every awesome bassist ever. fact.

name: liithe
text: I already decided this was a 5 by the third panel.
